info.title: Quran.com Auth V1 API
info.description:
Quran.com Auth V1 APIs allow your app to authenticate and interact with Quran Foundation's users' resources. 

 See it in action https://share.descript.com/view/rBczFqlYZQz 

 ## Pagination 

 We are using cursor based pagination. The pagination query params consist of `first`,`after`, `before` and `last`. 

 Example 
 - `first: 10` will give you first 10 items 
 - `first: 10, after: xyz` will give you first 10 items after the item with id `xyz` 
 - `last: 10` will give you the last 10 items 
 - `last: 10, before: xyz` will give you the last 10 items before the item with id `xyz` 

 The only possible combinations are `first + after` or `last + before`. They should not be used together

public.description: Whether the group is public or not.

active.description: Whether the group is active or not.

verified.description: Whether the group is verified or not. Will be `true` if it's a page.

subdomain.description: The subdomain of the page. Will be empty when it is a group.

group.description: The group slug. Will be empty when it is a page.

link.description: The link of the group/page. Will contain only the base domain when it is a page.

currentUserIsAdmin.description: Whether the current user is an admin or not.

fromAyah.description:
The start of the range of Ayah(s) in a Surah that the post relates to. 

 If it's a single Ayah,`fromAyah` and `toAyah` should have the same value. 

 If the post belongs to the entire Surah, `fromAyah` and `toAyah` should be left empty

toAyah.description:
The end of the range of Ayah(s) in a Surah that the post relates to. 

 If it's a single Ayah,`fromAyah` and `toAyah` should have the same value. 

 If the post belongs to the entire Surah, `fromAyah` and `toAyah` should be left empty

id.description: The id of the author of the comment.

username.description: The username of the author of the comment.

firstName.description: The first name of the author of the comment.

lastName.description: The first name of the author of the comment.

displayName.description: The display name of the author of the comment.

verified.description: Whether the comment's author has been verified.

profileImage.description: The profile image of the author of the comment. Will be `null` if it's empty

followed.description: Whether the current user is following the author of the comment or not.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the comment.

body.example: Ma shaa Allah Lahawla walaquwata illa billah

parentId.description: The parent comment's id. Will be `null` if this comment does not have a parent.

isPrivate.description: Whether the post should be publicly viewed or not.

publishedAt.description: The date the post was published at. Format of the date is `MMMM dd, yyyy HH:mm`

createdAt.description: The date the post was created at. Format of the date is `MMMM dd, yyyy HH:mm`

lastUpdated.description: The date the post was last updated. Format of the date is `MMMM dd, yyyy HH:mm`

liked.description: Whether the post was liked by the current user or not.

saved.description: Whether the post was saved by the current user or not.

verified.description: Whether the post is verified or not.

hidden.description: Whether the post is hidden or not.

global.description: Whether the post is global or not. A post inside a room can be set to global and becomes visible to everyone.

editable.description: Whether the post is editable or not. It will be `true` if the post belongs to the current user.

deletable.description: Whether the post is deletable or not. It will be `true` if the post belongs to the current user.

reportable.description: Whether the current user can report the post or not.

restorable.description: Whether the current user can restore the post after it was deleted or not.

comments.description: List of comments that belong to the post.

commentsCount.description: The number of comments the post has. This includes private comments.

publicCommentsCount.description: The number of public comments the post has.

roomId.description: The Id of the room the post belongs to.

group.description: The name of the group the post belongs to. Will be `null` it the post does not belong to a group.

groupLink.description: The link to the group the post belongs to. Will be `null` it the post does not belong to a group.

postTitle.description: A social-media sharable title of the post.
postTitle.example: Osama Sayed's Reflection on Surah Al-Aadiyaat:8

tags.description: List of tags the post belongs to. If `tags` not passed with update post API, existing references of the post will be removed.

estimatedReadingTime.description: The average number of milliseconds it takes to read the post. It can be `0` if the value could not be estimated.

body.description: The notification body. Might contain HTML.
body.example: Mohammad Elshinawy added a new reflection.

avatarUrl.description: The Avatar url of the user the notification is related to.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the notification.

postUrl.description: The post URL the notification is related to.

followNotification.description: User receives an email when someone follows the user

followedUserAddedPostNotification.description: User receives an email when someone the user follows adds a new post.

postCommentedNotification.description: Receive email when someone comments on the user's post.

postLikedNotification.description: Receive email when someone likes the user's post.

mentionNotification.description: User receives an email when someone mentions the user in a post or comment.

addedPostInGroupNotification.description: User receives an email when someone in a group the user is in creates a new post.

followPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone follows the user.

followedUserAddedPostPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone that the user follows adds a new post.

postCommentedPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone comments on the user's post.

postLikedPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone likes the user's post.

mentionPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone mentions the user in a post or comment.

addedPostInGroupPushNotification.description: User receives a notification when someone in a group the user is in creates a new post.

email.description: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, as discussed in Section 5.7.

first_name.description: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

last_name.description: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

introspectedOAuth2Token.description:
Introspection contains an access token's session data as specified by
[IETF RFC 7662](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7662)

example.scope: openid offline collection bookmark reading_session preference user

active.description:
Active is a boolean indicator of whether or not the presented token
is currently active.  The specifics of a token's "active" state
will vary depending on the implementation of the authorization
server and the information it keeps about its tokens, but a "true"
value return for the "active" property will generally indicate
that a given token has been issued by this authorization server,
has not been revoked by the resource owner, and is within its
given time window of validity (e.g., after its issuance time and
before its expiration time).

aud.description: Audience contains a list of the token's intended audiences.

client_id.description:
ID is aclient identifier for the OAuth 2.0 client that
requested this token.

exp.description:
Expires at is an integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds
since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating when this token will expire.

ext.description: Extra is arbitrary data set by the session.

iat.description:
Issued at is an integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds
since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating when this token was
originally issued.

iss.description: IssuerURL is a string representing the issuer of this token

nbf.description:
NotBefore is an integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds
since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating when this token is not to be
used before.

obfuscated_subject.description:
ObfuscatedSubject is set when the subject identifier algorithm was set to "pairwise" during authorization.
It is the `sub` value of the ID Token that was issued.

scope.description:
Scope is a JSON string containing a space-separated list of
scopes associated with this token.

sub.description:
Subject of the token, as defined in JWT [RFC7519].
Usually a machine-readable identifier of the resource owner who
authorized this token.

token_type.description: TokenType is the introspected token's type, typically `Bearer`.

token_use.description: TokenUse is the introspected token's use, for example `access_token` or `refresh_token`.

username.description:
Username is a human-readable identifier for the resource owner who
authorized this token.

example.scope: collection bookmark reading_session preference user openid offline

access_token.description: The access token issued by the authorization server.

expires_in.description:
The lifetime in seconds of the access token. For
example, the value "3600" denotes that the access token will
expire in one hour from the time the response was generated.

id_token.description: To retrieve a refresh token request the id_token scope.

refresh_token.description:
The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new
access tokens. To retrieve it add the scope "offline" to your access token request.

scope.description: The scope of the access token

token_type.description: The type of the token issued

error_debug.description:
Error Debug Information

Only available in dev mode.

error_hint.description:
Error Hint

Helps the user identify the error cause.
error_hint.example: The redirect URL is not allowed.

emptyResponse.description:
Empty responses are sent when, for example, resources are deleted. The HTTP status code for empty responses is
typically 201.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the payload of the ID Token, including `session.id_token` values, of
the provided OAuth 2.0 Access Token's consent request.

In the case of authentication error, a WWW-Authenticate header might be set in the response
with more information about the error. See [the spec](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6750#section-3)
for more details about header format.

post.description:
The introspection endpoint allows to check if a token (both refresh and access) is active or not. An active token
is neither expired nor revoked. If a token is active, additional information on the token will be included. You can
set additional data for a token by setting `session.access_token` during the consent flow.

scope.description:
An optional, space separated list of required scopes. If the access token was not granted one of the
scopes, the result of active will be false.

token.description:
The string value of the token. For access tokens, this
is the "access_token" value returned from the token endpoint
defined in OAuth 2.0. For refresh tokens, this is the "refresh_token"
value returned.

post.summary: Introspect OAuth2 Access and Refresh Tokens
